meanings.sent1: After playing outside in the sun, a cold glass of water slakes my thirst.
meanings.sent2: Drinking a refreshing smoothie slakes my desire for something sweet.
meanings.sent3: The juicy watermelon slakes my thirst and makes me smile.
meanings.sent4: Her kind words slaked the emotional thirst in my heart.
meanings.sent5: The rain finally slakes the dry earth, bringing relief to the plants.

meanings.definition: To cool or refresh by wetting
meanings.sent1: The breeze from the fan slakes my skin on a hot day.
meanings.sent2: Jumping into the pool slakes the heat of summer.
meanings.sent3: The splash of water slakes my face and wakes me up.
meanings.sent4: The cold drink slakes my throat like a refreshing waterfall.
meanings.sent5: The cool rain slakes the ground, bringing relief to the parched soil.

meanings.definition: To make less intense or severe
meanings.sent1: Taking a break slakes the stress of the busy day.
meanings.sent2: A nap can slake the intensity of a headache.
meanings.sent3: A funny joke slakes the tension in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her smile slakes the seriousness of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The apology slakes the anger, bringing peace to the conversation.
